event.description:
Discover the fascinating science lurking beneath the surface of history's most enduring legends at the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) with Bloodsuckers: Legends to Leeches.

Vampire bats and birds, live leeches and lampreys, and more of nature’s most bloodthirsty animals star in this ROM-original exhibition.

SPECIAL OFFER FOR KIDS - FEB 1 & 2!

Kids see Bloodsuckers: Legends to Leeches FREE with general admission purchase* on Saturday, February 1 and Sunday, February 2, 2020. 

Buy your tickets online and enter promo code ROMFUN or buy your tickets onsite at the Admissions Desk. Click here for more info on this promotion.
event.title: Bloodsuckers: Legends to Leeches at the ROM

event.description:
Inspire your toddler's imagination and sense of discovery as you explore the ROM's collection of art, history, and nature through the eyes of a child.

Bring your child on an eight-week sensory adventure as you tour galleries with our early learning instructors, and join them in creative play-based activities, and social interaction in a classroom setting. Meet other parents, caregivers, and children and engage your child in interactive learning for life.

Mark your calendar for the following session dates:

Fall 2019 - 8 Week Sessions:
Tuesdays, October 15 - December 3
Wednesdays, October 16 - December 4
Saturdays, October 19 - December 7

Winter 2020 - 8 Week Sessions:
Tuesdays, January 7 - February 25
Wednesdays, January 8 - February 26
Saturdays, January 11 - March 7 (excludes February 15)

Spring 2020 - 8 Week Sessions:
Tuesdays, April 7 - May 26
Wednesdays, April 8 - May 27
Saturdays, April 4 - June 6 (excludes April 11 & May 16)

Find out more at: www.rom.on.ca/en/whats-on/romkids-junior.
event.title: ROM Kids Jr.

event.description:
One of Toronto's most creative and diverse March Break day camps, we offer an exciting array of fun, activity-based programs inspired by our world-class Museum.

Our huge variety of offerings ensures that you'll find a program to match your interest and abilities. The ROM's fascinating galleries, authentic objects and outstanding professional staff guarantee that your camp experience will be hard to beat.

For children ages 5 to 14.
16 years of age or older? Interested in a career in science, history, art or education? We're looking for March Break Camp volunteers! Visit our website for more information.
Courses are taught by qualified instructors and classes are limited to 20 students.
Morning and afternoon (AM & PM) programs can be combined for full day camp
Half-day programs available – choose morning (AM) or afternoon (PM)
Early drop off begins at 8:00 AM
Supervised lunch for full day participants
Extended care available
event.title: ROM Kids March Break Camp

event.description:
We know it can be tricky to find things to do with a little one! So come and join a group of parents and babies for a docent-led tour of the BSM. Tours are held on the last Wednesday of every month.

$14 for parent and baby (under 5 years of age) | Free for Friends of the BSM | Please register by calling  416-979-7799 x 242 or emailing education@batashoemuseum.ca.
event.price: $14 at the door for parent and baby
event.title: Stroller Tours

event.description:
Step back in time to the Golden Age of Magic when world-renowned magicians travelled the world, promoting their acts with colourful, eye-catching posters.

Illusions: The Art of Magic transports you back in time to the Golden Age of Magic when death-defying tricks, daring escapes and colourful personas turned performers like The Incomparable Albini and Harry Houdini into world-famous celebrities.

Magicians of the late 19th and early 20th centuries were show business pioneers. They were among the first artists to embark on international tours and to promote themselves and their magical powers through illustrated advertisements ranging in scale from postcards to wall-sized posters.

Illusions: The Art of Magic will feature more than 55 colourful and stylized posters from the Allan Slaight Collection of the McCord Museum, Montreal, alongside photographs, films, documents and ephemera.
event.price: See Website - Members + 25 and under Free admission to AGO
event.title: Illusions: The Art of Magic at AGO

event.description:
In celebration of the ROM original exhibition Bloodsuckers: Legends to Leeches, the Museum is rolling out the (blood)-red carpet for families from February 1 until the coffin closes on the exhibition March 22.

Programming highlights include:

• A curated exhibition experience from our Family Experiences Concierge
• Interactions with real scientific specimens facilitated by ROM experts
• A Bloodsuckers photo booth
• Storytime with ROM teachers
• Arts and crafts
• Themed movies playing at the in-exhibition Vampire Family Cinema

Bloodsuckers Family Experiences runs from 11:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m. on weekends from Saturday, February 1 to Sunday, March 22, 2020 (including Family Day on February 17).

Bloodsuckers curators on site will include: Sebastian Kvist, the ROM's Curator of Invertebrates and Doug Currie, ROM Senior Curator of Entomology on select dates. Activities otherwise facilitated by ROM teachers and the ROM's Hands-On Biodiversity gallery staff.

SPECIAL OFFER FOR KIDS - FEB 1 & 2!

Kids see Bloodsuckers: Legends to Leeches FREE with general admission purchase* on Saturday, February 1 and Sunday, February 2, 2020. 

Buy your tickets online and enter promo code ROMFUN or buy your tickets onsite at the Admissions Desk. Click here for more info on this promotion.
event.price: Free with admission to Bloodsuckers exhibition
event.title: Bloodsuckers Family Experiences at the ROM
